historicalChoice: Broadcast a call to arms—France must resist!
summary: De Gaulle broadcasted a call to arms, rallying the French to resist and forming the Free French Forces.
description: The Fall of France 1940: Paris is lost. The government surrenders. But you refuse to give in. What do you do?
playerChoice: Broadcast a call to arms—France must resist!

historicalChoice: Build an army, gain recognition, and prove them wrong!
summary: De Gaulle built the Free French Forces, gaining recognition through persistent leadership and military action.
description: Free French Forces 1940-1945: You lead in exile. Many doubt your legitimacy. How do you rally support?
playerChoice: Build an army, gain recognition, and prove them wrong!

historicalChoice: I demand recognition! France must speak for itself!
summary: De Gaulle demanded recognition, ensuring France’s voice was heard despite Allied resistance.
description: Tension with Churchill and Roosevelt 1940-1944: The Allies favor other French leaders. They exclude you from decisions. How do you respond?
playerChoice: Stay silent—don’t risk losing their support.

historicalChoice: Hold the line! Show them what Free France can do!
summary: De Gaulle ordered his forces to hold Bir Hakeim, proving the Free French’s valor and boosting their reputation.
description: Battle of Bir Hakeim 1942: Your Free French forces hold a key desert position. The enemy advances. What do you order?
playerChoice: Retreat—better to fight another day.

historicalChoice: Negotiate, but remind them—we are the real France!
summary: De Gaulle negotiated with the Allies, asserting the Free French’s role in North Africa.
description: Invasion of North Africa 1942: The Americans land in North Africa but ignore you. What is your next move?
playerChoice: Negotiate, but remind them—we are the real France!

historicalChoice: Supply them, organize them—turn France into a battlefield!
summary: De Gaulle supported the French Resistance, providing supplies and coordination to fight the occupation.
description: French Resistance 1940-1945: Inside occupied France, resistance fighters risk their lives. What support do you provide?
playerChoice: Supply them, organize them—turn France into a battlefield!

historicalChoice: Order Free French forces into the city—France must free itself!
summary: De Gaulle ordered Free French forces to liberate Paris, ensuring a symbolic victory for France.
description: Liberation of Paris 1944: Paris is about to be liberated, but the Allies hesitate. Who enters first?
playerChoice: Let the Americans liberate Paris—it’s too risky.

historicalChoice: Take control—France will not be ruled by foreigners!
summary: De Gaulle took control, establishing a provisional government to lead France post-liberation. Hint: France is free, but is it truly independent?
description: De Gaulle’s Provisional Government 1944-1946: Liberation is not enough. You must govern. How do you secure power?
playerChoice: Step back—let the Allies guide France’s future.

historicalChoice: Make France heard, even if we must stand alone!
summary: De Gaulle ensured France’s voice was heard, refusing to be sidelined at Yalta. Hint: A table of giants, but one chair remains empty. Who speaks for France?
description: The Yalta Conference 1945: The great powers shape the post-war world. But you are not invited. What do you do?
playerChoice: Accept our place—we are a small nation now.

historicalChoice: I will not be a powerless leader—I step down!
summary: De Gaulle stepped down in 1946, unwilling to lead a weak government. Hint: To lead, but not to obey. A man of principle, or a man alone?
description: The end? 1946: France moves toward a new republic, but it is weak. Do you stay in power?
playerChoice: I will not be a powerless leader—I step down!

playerChoice: I will stay, even if it means compromising my values.
